results.title: Paddleboats of the Murray River
results.creator_credit: Sorena Productions, Rhonda Mabey, John Mabey and Roy Mason
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Ted Egan’s story of the Paddlewheelers of the mighty Murray River begins at Mannum in South Australia which claims to be the oldest of the riverboat towns. Ted travels on almost all the paddlewheelers beginning with “The Adelaide”. At Mildura a special race is staged for the new and old paddleboats featuring “The Melbourne”, “The Rothbury”, “The Avoca”, “The Coonawarra” and “The Murray River Queen”. At Swan Hill we see “The Gem”, “The Pyap” and a replica of the steam driven “Emmy Lou”. At Echuca Ted travels aboard the “Pevensey”, “The Adelaide” and the “Etona” and an old missionary boat.

results.title: Paddle to the sea
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: A children’s odyssey, from the story by Holling C. Holling. A film about a little Indian in a canoe, hand-carved in the northern forest and, in the spring, launched towards the sea. There are many adventures, all photographed with great patience and an eye for the beauty of living things. The film gives vivid impressions of Canada’s varied landscape and the life of its waterways. Commentary by Stanley Jackson. Awards: ten awards including Philadelphia; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.

results.title: Paddle Steamer Curlip
results.creator_credit: ACMI, David Withers and Kim Montgomery
results.brief_description: Join a group of passionate volunteers as they describe the trials, tribulations and joys of building and running a paddle steamer. From the initial planning in 2002, a group of Orbost locals built the PS Curlip II as part of a community project. After 16,000 hours of voluntary labour the paddle steamer was launched and continues in 2013 to transport tourists in and around the various waterways of East Gippsland. Members of the PS Curlip Committee talk about the history, their involvement and the future of the much-loved paddle steamer.

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.

results.title: Paddington recommended
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 6 from the book Paddington Takes the Air. While waiting to dine with the Browns at a fashionable restaurant, Paddington is mistaken for Duncan Hyde, the famous food expert. Hoping for a favourable review in his food guide, the manager offers Paddington a choice of meals on the house. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington makes a clean sweep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mr and Mrs Brown decide to begin spring cleaning and buy a chimney sweeping outfit. While Mr and Mrs Brown go to the sales, Paddington decides to lend a helping paw by cleaning the chimney but encounters problems when the brush becomes detached in the chimney and when he attempts to retrieve it, his head becomes stuck in the chimney pot! Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and Chris McCullough
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.

results.title: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington's puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.
results.creator_credit: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck, Ivor Wood and Barry Leith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
1. “Paddington in the hot seat”. Paddington has an audience ticket for the Quiz Show “Sage of Britain”. He gets lost in the studio complex and finds himself “on camera” where he is interviewed by Lionel Parr. He disputes the scoring and provides his opinion on proposed changes to British Television. The viewers jam the switchboard and Paddington is announced “Sage of Britain”. - 2. “Paddington’s puzzle”. Paddington makes a jigsaw puzzle as a present for Mr Gruber from a “priceless” old painting discarded by Mr Curry, some plywood and glue. - 3. “Paddington takes a cut”. Paddington reads “Clippings from my Hedgerow” and dreams he is pruning Mr Currys’ shrub into a peacock shape. Disaster strikes when he snips it leg off! However, awakes before discovery by Mr Curry!
results.title_for_label: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington’s puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck, Ivor Wood and Barry Leith
